timeline.message: Modify the string concat() usage in toString() function
Remove unused imports to fix checkstyle error

This commit relates to the issue #21556

timeline.bodyText: This cast can be moved to a variable as there are three casts happening for the same.
timeline.author: Kishanthan

replies.bodyText: Yes. changed into a variable in a9602ad
replies.author: HindujaB

timeline.bodyText: I don't think we need this line, since already checked in the while.
timeline.author: manuranga

replies.bodyText: No. we are here checking the element type of the element which is previously checked in while. Those are different checks.

replies.bodyText: it will be checked in the beginning of the next loop, won't it?
replies.author: manuranga

timeline.bodyText: why is this check moved outside of while loop's condition?
timeline.author: manuranga

replies.bodyText: Both methods works fine. But I used this as I thought this code is more clear to look at.
replies.author: HindujaB
manuranga

timeline.bodyText: insert is less efficient than append, can we move this above sb.append(getSizeString()); and use append ?
timeline.author: manuranga

replies.bodyText: No. The element getting changed in the loop. So, it must be added at last.
replies.author: HindujaB

timeline.message:
Modify union type toString method

This commit resolves the ambiguity in toString of union types. Eg.: (int|string[][4])[3] is clearer than int|string[][4][3]

timeline.bodyText:
can we please change this to match the style of the repo, using tag to check the sub class type.
bType.tag == TypeTags.ARRAY
timeline.author: manuranga

timeline.bodyText:
This was correct the way it was, typedesc map<int|string>
new format is redundant typedesc map<(int|string)>.
Only advance case like (int|boolean[6][4])[2][3] needs brackets
timeline.author: manuranga
